stories.text: After the widespread claims about LaMDA having achieved sentience, I was wondering what kind of test could validate such claims. For example, a test could incorporate additional sensory modalities or focus on specific aspects of intelligence (such as logical reasoning, mathematical ability, or linguistic skills). Are there any approaches to that?
stories.title: Ask HN: What will be the next Turing Test?

Ghost knowledge of applying machine learning
Hong Kong writer Ni Kuang, known for his Wisely sci-fi novels, dies at 87

stories.text:
I must say, working for a non technical manager is exhausting. Having to constantly explain basic things gets tiring very quickly.

I don't understand how a non technical person can "lead" a technical team. How can they even help the team because they don't even understand basic concepts. How are these people getting these technical jobs is beyond me. I keep running into these "engineering managers" who know nothing about engineering and I'm sick and tired of it. I just want a technical manager who is on the same level as the technical people on the team or at least understands what the engineers are talking about during meetings.
stories.title: Do you prefer your manager to be technical or non technical?
The insane study routine of Sir Isaac Newton
